intro: Coelospermum paniculatum, commonly known as the clustered redroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, showy red flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while its roots are thick and fleshy. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
